issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A new unit, integration or system test.
issuetype.name: Test

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When a block is reported from a data node while the block is under construction (i.e. not committed or completed), BlockManager calls BlockInfoUnderConstruction.addReplicaIfNotPresent() to update the reported replica state. But BlockManager is calling it with the stored block, not reported block.  This causes the recorded replicas' gen stamp to be that of BlockInfoUnderConstruction itself, not the one from reported replica.

When a pipeline recovery is done for the last packet of a block, the incremental block reports with the new gen stamp may come before the client calling updatePipeline(). If this happens, these replicas will be incorrectly recorded with the old gen stamp and get removed later.  The result is close or addAdditionalBlock failure.

If the last block is completed, but the penultimate block is not because of this issue, the file won't be closed. If this file is not cleared, but the client goes away, the lease manager will try to recover the lease/block, at which point it will crash. I will file a separate jira for this shortly.

The worst case is to reject all good ones and accepting a bad one. In this case, the block will get completed, but the data cannot be read until the next full block report containing one of the valid replicas is received.
fields.summary: Write pipeline recovery for the last packet in the block may cause rejection of valid replicas

comments.body:
The patch modifies {{BlockManager.addStoredBlockUnderConstruction()}} to update {{BlockInfoUnderContruction}} with the reported block, not the stored block itself.

In this method, the old behavior is restored if {{ucBlock.storedBlock}} is used instead of {{ucBlock.reportedBlock}}. The unit test will fail with the old behavior.

An incorrect assertion is removed from {{DFSOutputStream}}. The assertion is only correct if the block is the last block. If there is more data to be written beyond this block, it fails.

{color:red}-1 overall{color}.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12615433/HDFS-5557.patch
  against trunk revision .

    {color:green}+1 @author{color}.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    {color:green}+1 tests included{color}.  The patch appears to include 1 new or modified test files.

    {color:red}-1 javac{color:red}.  The patch appears to cause the build to fail.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HDFS-Build/5551//console

This message is automatically generated.
I shouldn't have relied on maven dependency tracking without doing "mvn clean". An updated patch shall come soon.
Uploading updated patch that fixes the test compilation problem.

bq. If the last block is completed, but the penultimate block is not because of this issue, the file won't be closed. If this file is not cleared, but the client goes away, the lease manager will try to recover the lease/block, at which point it will crash. I will file a separate jira for this shortly.

HDFS-5558 has been filed for this.

This message is automatically generated.

Great finding Kihwal.
Patch looks quite good and test fails without actual fix.
I have following comments:

{code}+      DFSTestUtil.createFile(fileSys, file, 68000000L, (short)numDataNodes, 0L);{code}
Here why you exactly used *68000000L* ? wanted to write more than one block?
 If yes then you might have to set the block size to 64MB, default is 128M now in trunk.

bq. If the last block is completed, but the penultimate block is not because of this issue, the file won't be closed.
Better to add a test for this too, You can reproduce this failing the last packet of only penultimate block. for that you might need to change Mock statement in test and one more line in DFSOutputStream.java to following
{code}Mockito.when(faultInjector.failPacket()).thenReturn(true, false);{code}
and 
{code}if (isLastPacketInBlock
                && DFSClientFaultInjector.get().failPacket()){code}


Also I looked at the patch HDFS-5558,
I think that will not solve the issue mentioned there i.e. crashing of LeaseManager monitor thread. that fix actually comes in flow of client's completeFile() call, not from lease recovery. That change might be required in this issue, to block the client committing the last block.

bq. I think that will not solve the issue mentioned there i.e. crashing of LeaseManager monitor thread. that fix actually comes in flow of client's completeFile() call, not from lease recovery. That change might be required in this issue, to block the client committing the last block.
Oops. Sorry for not completely understanding the problem. lastBlock can be complete without completed penultimate block only if client calls completeFile() and fails.

bq. Here why you exactly used 68000000L ? wanted to write more than one block? If yes then you might have to set the block size to 64MB, default is 128M now in trunk.

It doesn't have to write more than one block. I tried that, but the problem is reproduced without writing more than one block. But multiple packets is still better. It's an arbitrary number.

[~daryn] spotted a bug in {{setGenerationStampAndVerifyReplicas()}}. It was checking for null replicas and returning before setting the gen stamp. Although in practice this bug doesn't trigger, it is logically wrong.  Attaching a new patch.
The patch also applies to branch-0.23 except against one test case. It can be ignored, since 0.23 does not need the test case to be updated.
